game.desc: In Crescendo, teams shoot circular notes into their speaker or amp before climbing onto the chain on the centerstage and put a note into the trap and allowing the human player to throw a ring onto a microphone on top of the stage. Crescendo, sponsored by Qualcomm, is part of an all-FIRST series about art

robot.name: Croppenheimer
features: Omni-Directional Under the Bumper Intake System

regionals.name: Central Missouri Regional
regionals.notes: Also recieved the Jack Kamen Imagery Award

regionals.name: Iowa Regional
regionals.notes: Also recieved the Creativity in Design Award

gallery.caption: Michael watches a match while preparing to coach the drive team

game.desc: In Charged Up, teams place cones and inflated cubes on a grid to make connected links before balancing the robot on their charging station. Charged Up, sponsored by Qualcomm, is part of an all-FIRST series about renewable energy.

robot.name: Corn on the Claw*
robot.goal: This year, our primary goals were to score both cubes and cones in the high grid space and have a self-balancing auto. *Special Note: This year's robot also answers to the names Corn Wallace and Cob Cannon.

gallery.caption: How many children of the corn fit in an elevator?
Members working together to build the drivebase.
Members Ava and Matthew teaching kids to drive the robot at the Iowa Children's Museum.

game.desc: In Rapid React, teams launch or slide cargo into the hub and terminal before climbing the hangar. Rapid React, sponsored by Boeing, is part of an all-FIRST game series on sustainable transportation.

robot.name: General Cornelius
robot.goal: This year, our primary goals of the season were to reliably shoot balls into the high goal and climb to the traversal rung.  Additionally, we created a two ball autonomous program.

regionals.name: Iowa Regional
regionals.notes: Also received the Jack Kamen Imagery Award.

gallery.caption: Pre-season outreach event at the Iowa State Fair.
Team working through problem with mentor Tom.

game.desc: In Game Changers, teams launch power cells into power port, spin and align a control panel, and climb a shield generator. Game Changers was an adaptation of the 2020 game, Infinite Recharge, suited for socially distanced competition.

robot.name: Replay
robot.goal: Due to time constraints and COVID-19, we used our 2020 robot, Replay, with minor tweaks for INFINITE RECHARGE At Home. For the offseason competitions after that, we made significant improvements to each of Replay's subsystems.

gallery.caption: Beginning a match with our alliance.
Our team working on the robot at a competition.
A team member teaching a young child about driving robots.
A test of our new swerve drivetrain following a predetermined path autonomously.

game.desc: In Infinite Recharge, teams launch power cells into power port, spin and align a control panel, and climb a shield generator.

robot.name: Replay
robot.goal: With the abolition of Stop Build Day in 2020, we designed an ambitious robot. Our top priorities were cycling power cells quickly while avoiding defense and climbing. So, we created a short robot with a circular indexing system and a vision-enabled shooter. In addition, we designed a fast climbing mechanism.

regionals.name: Iowa Regional
regionals.placing: Event canceled due to the COVID-19 outbreak

regionals.name: FIRST Detroit Championship
regionals.placing: Event canceled due to the COVID-19 outbreak

game.desc: In Destination: Deep Space, teams attempt to complete two rockets and a cargo ship with "hatch panels" and "cargo". In addition, they can score points by climbing the "HAB platform" during endgame.

robot.name: Thwack
robot.goal: This year, our primary goal was to cycle hatch panels and cargo as quickly as possible at all heights, reducing the need for an endgame climb. To this end, we designed a robot with a telescopic lifting mechanism and I/O mechanisms for each game piece.

game.desc: In FIRST Power Up, teams compete to tip the scales: balances are scattered throughout the field and teams must use "power cubes" to tip them in a particular direction.

robot.name: Slick
robot.goal: This year, our primary goal was to be able to reliably deliver cubes to the scale. To this end, we designed a robot with a telescopic lifting mechanism and an associated cube-locomotion mechanism.

regionals.name: FIRST Detroit Championship Curie Division
regionals.placing: 51st seed Curie Division; eliminated in qualification matches

gallery.caption: A test run of an early prototype.
Team members try to work out cable management.
The bagged final product at the end of the build season.

game.desc: In FIRST Steamworks, robots are to fire "fuel" into the steam boilers, as well as collect gears and deliver them to human players on the field.

robot.name: Windy
robot.goal: We tasked ourselves with designing and constructing a robot capable of anything. Windy can fire fuel, deploy gears, and climb the rope during the endgame.

gallery.caption: Team 167 at the kickoff in Cedar Falls, IA.
Assembling our gear collection mechanism.
Testing our gear deployment.
Our drive train in its early stages.
One of our new members trying to acquaint themselves with CSS.

game.desc: The goal of FIRST Stronghold was to launch balls into the enemy goals while also "breaching" enemy defenses to gain points.

robot.name: Fido
robot.goal: We wanted to build a robot that can traverse defenses efficiently while also being able to score both high and low goals without too much difficulty.

regionals.name: Iowa Regional
regionals.notes: The first FRC regional in Iowa.

regionals.name: North Star Regional
regionals.notes: A plastic component of our drive train shattered, rendering our robot immobile and us unable to continue semifinals.

gallery.caption: Mr. Schares carefully inserting the flux capacitor that powers our hyperspace drive train.

game.desc: In Recycle Rush, teams had to stack recycling crates and trash bins to earn points.

robot.name: Shanequa
robot.goal: This year, our goal was to create a robot able to create tall stacks via a forklift-like system.

gallery.caption: Our robot

game.desc: In Aerial Assist, teams work to move large exercise balls down the field. Teams earn large bonuses for assisting teammates in scoring.
In Ultimate Ascent, teams pick up and launch frisbees into narrow goals above the field. Then, teams scale a runged pyramid.
In Rebound Rumble, teams try to score foam basketballs in baskets with vision targets.
